experience: You and Kamal both know Rama Bokka, Mark Casey, PMP, CSM, and 15 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017

Designing, building and maintaining Schwab's internal cloud platform. Heavy focus on the data side. Product owner for multiple offerings which allow app development teams to use a cloud environment.Emphasis on recognizing/deconstructing problems and designing/creating services which promote automation.

•	Inventor on 250+ patent disclosures with 73+ patent applications pending.•	eBay Marketplaces’ most prolific inventor in 2013, among top 1% in 2014.•	Also started/led a patent brainstorming group at eBayo	Mentoring others to develop their ideas into patent disclosures.

•	Collaborating with worldwide teams to develop & maintain eBay Post Transaction platformo	Millions of dollars in transactions per day, hundreds of thousands of clicks per day•	Major contributor on delivering next generation Post Transaction experience (full stack)o	Created proof of concept RESTful APIs to serve as an example for other developerso	Instrumental member of core team which implemented new UI and backend applicationso	Transitioning from monolithic, tightly coupled desktop experience to a more modern, loosely coupled & multi-screen experienceo	Handle Pull Master/CM duties and release engineering for team deliverables.o	Mentoring junior teammates and serving as a SME on a variety of issues.  Code reviewed every team commit.•	Key member of team that delivered 1st multi country and secured Node.js app in eBay•	Main contributor to designing and implementing new “View Order Details” page which receives millions of hits a day•	J2EE, Oracle, TestNG, JUnit, Spring, Git & eBay Frameworks (based on Eclipse, JMS, JAX-RS)•	As a side project, automating manual processes using Java/Teradata/Bash/Javascript•	Member of technical interview team.  Evaluating RCGs, senior engineers and patent counsel.

•	Developed situational awareness platform for NASA JPL’s Mars Science Laboratory (Curiosity)•	Designed, developed and implemented software simulations of hardware for DARPA F6 project•	J2EE/Perl leveraging JBoss, Hibernate, MySQL, ANT, ActiveMQ and JIDE•	Mentored  junior teammates to foster a strong development team

•	Led a team of software engineers that developed critical real-time embedded software and other applications used for guiding US Navy situational awareness radar systems worldwideo	My team contributed software for the successful US satellite demolition in Feb 2008 o	Software is deployed on US Navy Aegis cruisers worldwide•	Managed software development schedules (full lifecycle), interfaced with customers’ leadership and technical staff through site visits, regular briefings and frequent project technical and progress presentations•	Successfully mentored and managed software development team to meet customers’ expectations and deliver high quality products on schedule and within budget•	Led C++ software development on Linux platforms (Gentoo & CentOS)•	Served as project’s customer interface and interact with customers’ technical staff daily•	Presented important project milestones to high ranking customers (Navy Commanders)•	Managed daily communication and collaboration with other vendors’ development teams to ensure the successful integration of my team’s solution to form final product
The University of Texas at Austin

•	BS in Computer Science with a minor in Business and a concentration in Mathematics•	Dean’s List – UT Austin Fall 2003 and Spring 2006Highlights from some courses:Compilers	•	Used Lex & Yacc to create a Pascal compiler for the Sun SPARC architectureOperating Systems	•	Modeled single and multi-processor scheduling algorithms using Java•	Implemented a simple CPU and OS simulator with a two level page tableArchitecture	•	Redefined a Java Fibonacci program in x86 assembly code•	Created a Java program to “optimally thrash” a Pentium III processorAutomata Theory	•	Created a Finite State Machine simulator (deterministic and non) using Perl

Helped build foundations, build walls and move construction materials for some great families in Karwar, Karnataka, India.  eBay provided me with a great opportunity to help volunteer.  Very thankful for the experience.

I had interviewed Kamal for a position at Ultra Electronics, and I was impressed with his understanding of and appreciation for Software Engineering.  Having later worked with Kamal on various projects and tasks at Ultra, I have determined that my initial impressions if him were spot on, and he had become a valuable team member with a keen interest in creating really great software.  Not only did Kamal have a strong technical understanding, but he was also a very friendly and approachable team member.  The combination of these strengths make him a valuable asset.  I would not hesitate to recommend Kamal to a programing position, nor would I hesitate to choose him for any team I was leading.
